intro: Paraphlomis shunchangensis var. pubicarpa, commonly known as the pubicarp Chinese grass, is a rare and endemic plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically purple or violet, with two-lipped petals typical of the mint family. It is often found in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions.
